intro: Hebecarpa rossychaveziae, commonly known as the Rossychavezia hebecarpa, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a humid climate with partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
